docs.title: Welcome to Project Chatur Documentation
docs.text:
What is Chatur?

Chatur is short for Chaturvedi चतुर, meaning a person who has studied all four (chatur) Vedas and therefore is learned or smart.

docs.title: About Chatur
docs.text:
Project Chatur was developed at The University of Arizona in the Data Science Institute, by members of the CyVerse.org

The goal behind Project Chatur was to develop a fully open-source large langauge model chat interface for education and research.

Contact us:

docs.title: Chatur Backend
docs.text:
The Chatur Backend includes virtual machines running on a self-managed OpenStack Cloud.

We'll use the analogy of building a digital boat for the project.

Chatur is built of a combination of open-source projects including:

Backend - Rudder LLM - Sails/Propellers UI - Crow's Nest UX - Anchor FastChat LangServ(LangChain) PrivateGPT Tests Ray.io ollama React / NextJS QA/QC CyVerse Mistral MaterialUI Jetstream-2 OAuth

Ansible Playbooks are used to deploy the software on OpenStack Cloud managed hardware

K8s Helm Charts deploy the backend API

NextJS and React are used for the https:// user interface UI

OAuth & LDAP secure authentication are provided by CyVerse and University of Arizona.

docs.title: Deploy Chatur
docs.text:
Chatur is deployed using Ansible Playbooks and Kubernetes (K8s)

Ansible Playbooks and Helm Charts are hosted here: https://github.com/cyverse/chatur-api

docs.title: Log into Chatur
docs.text:
In order to connect to Chatur, you must have a CyVerse Account and a University of Arizona NetID

You can connect your UArizona NetID to your CyVerse Account in the CyVerse KeyCloak

Development deployment: https://chatur-dev.cyverse.ai

docs.title: Manage Files
docs.text:
Chatur uses Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) of supplied knowledge (document files) to generate its responses.

Instructors should provide document files in: .pdf, .md, .docx, .pptx, .txt format
